SEARCH

Class Enquiry

Object
Enquiry
public class Enquiry extends Object
The Enquiry class represents an enquiry with an optional reply. It tracks the content of the enquiry, any reply associated with it, and whether the enquiry has been processed. Enquiries can be set, replied to, and viewed.

The class includes methods for setting the inquiry, replying to the inquiry, viewing the enquiry and its reply, and retrieving the enquiry content.

An enquiry is considered processed once it has been replied to by either staff or committee members.

Example usage: 

 Enquiry inquiry = new Enquiry();
 inquiry.setEnquiry("Can I get more information about the upcoming event?");
 inquiry.replyEnquiry("Sure! Here are the details you requested.");
 inquiry.viewEnquiry();
Author:
Gao Linyue

  • Constructor Details

    • Enquiry

      public Enquiry()
      Constructs a new Enquiry object with default values. The enquiry content, reply, and processed status are initially set to null, null, and false respectively.

  • Method Details

    • setEnquiry

      public void setEnquiry(String enquiry)

    • replyEnquiry

      public void replyEnquiry(String reply)
      Replies to the content of the enquiry and set processed as true.
      Parameters:
      reply - The reply to the enquiry.

    • viewEnquiry

      public void viewEnquiry()
      Prints the content of the enquiry and any corresponding reply to the console. If no reply is available, only the enquiry content is printed.

    • getEnquiry

      public String getEnquiry()
      Prints the content of the enquiry and any corresponding reply to the console. If no reply is available, only the enquiry content is printed.

    • getProcessed

      public boolean getProcessed()
      Checks if the enquiry has been processed.
      Returns:
      true if the enquiry has been processed, false otherwise.
